newsitem.title: GREECE: MICHANIKI SEES 96 EARNINGS GROWTH OF 25PCT.
newsitem.headline: MICHANIKI SEES 96 EARNINGS GROWTH OF 25PCT.

text.p: Greek construction firm Michaniki expects to post earnings growth of 25.5 percent in 1996 with pretax profit reaching 5.1 billion drachmas, its chief financial officer told Reuters.
He said pretax profit is expected to advance 39 percent to 7.1 billion drachmas in 1997.

"Michaniki proved it can achieve strong earnings growth capitalising on its competitive edge in know-how and mechanical equipment when it comes to large, complex construction projects," said chief financial officer Aris Drakatos.

Fiscal 1996 turnover rose 19 percent to 23 billion drachmas and should shoot up to 27 billion this year. On a consolidated basis, the Michaniki group expects to post 1996 turnover of 26.9 billion drachmas, 35.3 billion in 1997, he told Reuters.
Its dividend payout for 1996 will be close to 50 percent. Its 1995 dividend per share was 115 drachmas.
Drakatos said Michaniki's orderbook stood at 133 billion drachmas. Of this amount 37.2 billion drachmas had to do with yet uncompleted projects.

Self-financed BOT projects which also include projected operational revenues amounted to 55 billion drachmas. Such projects included the Rhodes Casino, a parking facility at Kotzias square in Athens and the cemetary of Piraeus.
Michaniki also projects revenues of 41.2 billon drachmas from other real estate operations -- sales and rental income.
"We have strategically diversified our portfolio and are no longer just a construction firm. We expect that in the next four years EU funding for infrastructure projects will dry up," Drakatos said.
Shares of Michaniki gained 35 drachmas to close at 2,235 on heavy volume of 127,070 shares. --George Georgiopoulos, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
